member.name: T:EvoPdf.Blending
member.summary: The blending function for transparent rendering mode.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.Blending.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode
member.summary: The view mode when an explicit destination is displayed in the viewer.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.XYZ
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left,Â top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.Fit
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitB
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitBH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitBV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore
member.summary: Provides and interface for getting digital certificates from system certificates store or from a password protected PKCS#12 file. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public keys and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the Personal Certificates store. The Personal Certificates store can be accessed from Control Panel/Internet Options, Content, Certificates.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(EvoPdf.CertSystemStore)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified system certificates store.
member.param: The system certificates store

member.name: M:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified PKCS#12 file. This method uses a NULL password to get the certificates from packet. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The path of the .pfx or .p12 file storing the certificates.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified password protected PKCS#12 file. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The path of the .pfx or .p12 file storing the certificates.

The password used to decrypt and verify the PFX packet. This password must be exactly the same as the password that was used to encrypt the packet. If the password used to encrypt the packet was blank, pass NULL for the value of this parameter.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.Document.#ctor(EvoPdf.PdfStandardSubset)
member.summary: Creates a PDF document based on the specified PDF standard. By default the Full PDF stadard is used. This property can be used to create PDF/A or PDF/X compliant documents.
member.param: The PDF standard used to create the PDF document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.Document.#ctor(EvoPdf.ColorSpace)
member.summary: Creates a PDF document with the specified color space. This property can be used to create PDF documents in RGB, Grayscale or CMYK color spaces. By default the document uses the RGB color space.
member.param: The color space of the document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.Document.#ctor(EvoPdf.PdfStandardSubset,EvoPdf.ColorSpace)

The color space of the document.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.Document.Close
member.summary: Releases all the resources allocated by this PDF document. Always call this method after the document was saved. If the document was created from a stream or file, the stream will be closed if it was not explicitly detached by calling the DetachStream() before the document is closed.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.Document.DetachStream
member.summary: Call this method to detach the stream from which this document was created. When this method is called before calling Close(), the Close method will not close the detached stream.

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the transparency is enabled in the PDF document. Default value is true. This property can be set to false to eliminate the additional flattening time when the document is sent to the printer from Adobe Reader viewer.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.Document.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the PDF document compression level. By default the compression level is

member.name: P:EvoPdf.Document.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the generated PDF. By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated PDF. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated PDF is lower than the quality of the original images in the HTML document, function of the parameter. When the is increased, the quality of the images in PDF decreases.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.Document.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets the compression level of images in the generated PDF as an integer value between 0 and 100. This property has effect only when the JpegCompressionEnabled is true. When the is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst. The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in PDF.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Defines the necessary API to retrieve the positions in the generated PDF document for the HTML elements specified in a list. The HTML elements to map are specified by the CSS selectors given by the property or by the special HTML attributes in HTML document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions.HtmlElementSelectors
member.summary: This property is used to set an array containing the selectors of the HTML elements for which to retrieve position in PDF. For example, the selector for all the image elements is "img", the selector for all the elements with the CSS class name 'myclass' is "*.myclass" and the selector for the elements with the id 'myid' is "*#myid". The elements mapping will be retrieved in the property after conversion.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions.MapHiddenElements
member.summary: A flag indicating if the mapping of hidden elements is enabled. This property is true by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions.HtmlElementsMappingResult
member.summary: This property is set by the converter after conversion and returns the mapping of the HTML elements selected by the selectors.

The virtual browser width in pixels. The default value is 1024 pixels. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width. When this parameter is less or equal 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page width from the HTML document content.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PrepareRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised after the HTML to Image element created the PDF page and before starting rendering it. In the handler of this event the PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer can still be changed before starting rendering.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.BeforeRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right before the page is rendered by HTML to Image element. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the background of the PDF page to be rendered.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.AfterRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the HTML to Image element finished PDF page rendering. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the foreground of the rendered PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred HTML viewer width in pixels of the HTML to Image element. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width can also be specified in the class constructor. The default value is 1024 pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels of the HTML to Image element. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the property of the class. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer height can also be specified in the class contructor. The default value is 0 to automatically determine the HTML viewer height based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the HTML document to be converted to image

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.Html
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML string to be converted to image

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.BaseUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the base URL of the HTML string to be converted to image

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the x position in points where the rendered image will be placed in PDF page

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the y position in points where the rendered image will be placed in PDF page

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination width in points of the rendered image. If the specified width is less or equal to 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination height in points of the rendered image. If the specified height is less or equal to 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.TopSpacing
member.summary: A space in points to introduce at the top of PDF pages where the HTML is rendered to image. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the top spacing is 0.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.BottomSpacing
member.summary: A space in points to introduce at the bottom of PDF pages where the HTML is rendered to image. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the bottom spacing is 0.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ClipHtmlView
member.summary: If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer of the HTML to Image element at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the HtmlViewerWidth property. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the resulted image will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When false the image will be rendered at the real size. By default this property is true and the image will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the resulted image will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect in HTML to Image element only when property is true. When is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.InsertNewPagesMode
member.summary: A flag indicating if the HTML to Image element will always insert a new page in the PDF document when rendering next page instead of trying to use an already existing PDF page. This property is false by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the HTML to Image element converter to convert the HTML links to PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.InteractiveHiddenElements
member.summary: A flag indicating if the interactive features are enabled for hidden HTML elements. This property is false by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the HTML to Image element converter to convert the internal HTML links to internal PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if JavaScript execution is enabled in the HTML to Image element converter. The default is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.Enable3DTransformations
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the accelerated CSS 3D transformations are enabled in the HTML to Image element converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.EnableWebGL
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the WebGL is enabled in the HTML to Image element converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.EnableAccelerated2DCanvas
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the accelerated 2D canvas is enabled in the HTML to Image element converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.Paginate
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML to Image element can be paginated to render many PDF pages if necessary.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HttpPostFields
member.summary: Returns the collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page in HTML to Image element. If there are elements in collection then the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection, otherwise it will make a GET request

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type of the HTML document used by the HTML to Image element. The default media type is 'screen'. If you set this property with 'print' then the CSS properties defined in '@media print' rule will be used to render the document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.SvgFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the SVG fonts are enabled in HTML in the HTML to Image element converter. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.WebFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the Web Fonts are enabled in HTML in the HTML to Image element converter. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ExtensionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML viewer extensions are executed in the HTML to Image element converter. The default value is false and no extension is executed. The Flash player for Google Chrome must be installed in order to execute the flash content from HTML

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.DownloadAllResources
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML to Image element should try to download all the resources even if this could cause a slower conversion. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PrerenderEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML to Image element should perform a pre-rendering. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.InterruptSlowJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the slow JavaScript script should be interrupted in HTML to Image element converter. The default value is false and the scripts are not interrupted

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.RenderedHtmlElementSelector
member.summary: Get or set the CSS selector of the HTML element to be rendered by the HTML to Image element. If the selector selects multiple HTML elements, only the the first one will be converted. The CSS selector is case sensitive. If this property is not set then the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.MaxHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels to be rendered from the HTML document by the HTML to Image element. The default value is 0 and the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.MinHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height in pixels to be rendered from HTML document by the HTML to Image element. This value of this property is ignored if the HtmlViewerHeight property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.InitialHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial height in pixels of the HTML viewer in HTML to Image element. This value of this property is ignored if the HtmlViewerHeight property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.DefaultHtmlEncoding
member.summary: The default HTML document text encoding to be used if there is no charset meta tag defined in the HTML document. By default this property is not set and an auto determined text encoding will be used by converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ImagePartSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels of an image part in HTML to Image element

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.TriggeringMode
member.summary: The conversion triggering mode used by the HTML to Image element converter. The default value is Auto

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be completely loaded or for a web page redirect to finish before starting the rendering in HTML to Image element.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The HTML to Image element converter navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the HTML to Image element converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the method of the property. The property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. By default the property is false and the custom headers are not automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested. The custom HTTP headers can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser. The preferred method to send cookies is to use the property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PersistentHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: This property can be set on true to instruct the HTML to Image element converter to send the custom headers defined by the HttpRequestHeaders property each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. The default value of this property is true and the custom headers are automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HttpRequestCookies
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the HTML to Image element converter to the web server when the web page to convert and the resources (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page are requested. A cookie is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the method of the property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.XPSupplementalLanguages
member.summary: A flag in HTML to Image element indicating if the supplemental languages (complex script, right-to-left, East Asian) support was enabled in Windows XP Regional and Language Options. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.AvoidImageBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the HTML to Image element converter to try to avoid cutting off the images between PDF pages

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.AvoidHtmlElementsBreakSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements to not be broken between PDF pages if possible when the HTML to Image element is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PageBreakBeforeHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements before which to force a page break in PDF document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PageBreakAfterHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements after which to force a page break in PDF document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.EvoInternalFileName
member.summary: Sets the full path of evointernal.dat helper file of the HTML to Image element. By default this file is expected to be found in the same folder with evohtmltopdf.dll assembly.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object encapsulating the proxy options used by the HTML to Image element to access the HTML document to convert.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: This property can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted in HTML to Image element. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.ImpersonationOptions
member.summary: The impersonation options applied during navigation in HTML to Image element

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation in PDF for the HTML to Image element. In order to enable creation of bookmarks you have to set the property of class with the CSS selectors of the HTML elements you want to bookmark.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that can be used to obtain the position in PDF of the HTML elements rendered by the HTML to Image element. In order to retrieve the position in PDF for a list of HTML elements, the property of class must be set with an array of strings containing the CSS selectors of the HTML elements you want to map. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the object after the element was added to the page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.RenderedPagesRectangles
member.summary: The bounds of the rectangle rendered in each PDF page by the HTML to Image element. This property is assigned after the element has been added to a PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets an object populated after conversion with the title, keywords, and description of the converted HTML document rendered by the HTML to Image element.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement
member.summary: This class encapsulates a HTML to PDF converter functionality. Objects of this class can be added at any location in a PDF page or Template to render HTML. The conversion is performed when the element is added to a page or Template.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.DEFAULT_HTML_VIEWER_WIDTH_PX
member.summary: The default virtual browser width in pixels

member.name: F:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AUTO_HTML_VIEWER_HEIGHT_PX
member.summary: The default virtual browser height in pixels is set to autodetect the HTML content height.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AVAILABLE_PDF_WIDTH_POINTS
member.summary: The default width in PDF of the element is set to available width in PDF page.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AUTO_PDF_HEIGHT_POINTS
member.summary: The default width in PDF of the element is set to available width in PDF page.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element that will be rendered at the (0,0) location in PDF page using a base URL to resolve the external resources. The width of element in PDF page is the available width in PDF page and the height is auto determined.
member.param: The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element that will be rendered at the (0,0) location in PDF page using a base URL to resolve the external resources and a document URL to resolve the internal links. The width of element in PDF page is the available width in PDF page and the height is auto determined.
member.param: The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used.
The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML string.

member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The virtual browser width in pixels. The default value is 1024 pixels. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width.

The virtual browser height in pixels. The default value is 0 which means the height will be auto-determined. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width and height. When this parameter is less or equal to 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page height from the HTML document content.

member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The destination height in points for the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered. Please note that the specified height is the effective height that will be rendered in the PDF document and does not include for example the empty spaces introduced by custom or automatic page breaks.
The URL to convert to PDF
The virtual browser width in pixels. The default value is 1024 pixels. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width.

The virtual browser height in pixels. The default value is 0 which means the height will be auto-determined. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width and height. When this parameter is less or equal to 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page height from the HTML document content.
The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML document. This parameter is necessary when the converted URL is not the full URL of a document.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PrepareRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised after the HTML to PDF element created the PDF page and before starting rendering it. In the handler of this event the PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer can still be changed before starting rendering.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.BeforeRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right before the page is rendered by HTML to PDF element. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the background of the PDF page to be rendered.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AfterRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the HTML to PDF element finished PDF page rendering. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the foreground of the rendered PDF page.

member.name: E:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.NavigationCompletedEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the converter finished the navigation and before rendering HTML content to PDF

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred HTML viewer width in pixels of the HTML to PDF element. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width can also be specified in the class constructor. The default value is 1024 pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels of the HTML to PDF element. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the property of the class. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer height can also be specified in the class contructor. The default value is 0 to automatically determine the HTML viewer height based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the HTML document to be converted to PDF

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.Html
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML string to be converted to PDF

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.BaseUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the base URL of the HTML string to be converted to PDF

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the x position in points where the rendered content will be placed in PDF page

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the y position in points where the rendered content will be placed in PDF page

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination width in points of the rendered content. If the specified width is less or equal to 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination height in points of the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal to 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.TopSpacing
member.summary: A space in points to introduce at the top of PDF pages where the HTML element is rendered. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the top spacing is 0.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.BottomSpacing
member.summary: A space in points to introduce at the bottom of PDF pages where the HTML element is rendered. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the bottom spacing is 0.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ClipHtmlView
member.summary: If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer of the HTML to PDF element at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the property. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AvoidTextBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the HTML to PDF element converter to try to avoid cutting off the text between PDF pages. This property is true by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AvoidImageBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the HTML to PDF element converter to try to avoid cutting off the images between PDF pages

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AvoidHtmlElementsBreakSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements to not be broken between PDF pages if possible when the HTML to PDF element is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PageBreakBeforeHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements before which to force a page break in PDF document when the HTML to PDF element is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PageBreakAfterHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements after which to force a page break in PDF document when the HTML to PDF element is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the content produced by the HTML to PDF element will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When false the HTML content will be rendered at the real size. By default this property is true and the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the content produced by the HTML to PDF element will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect in HTML to PDF element only when property is true. When is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the HTML to PDF element to convert the HTML links to PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.InteractiveHiddenElements
member.summary: A flag indicating if the interactive features are enabled for hidden HTML elements. This property is false by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the HTML to PDF element to convert the internal HTML links to internal PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if JavaScript execution is enabled in HTML to PDF element converter. The default is true.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.Enable3DTransformations
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the accelerated CSS 3D transformations are enabled in the HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.EnableWebGL
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the WebGL is enabled in the HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.EnableAccelerated2DCanvas
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the accelerated 2D canvas is enabled in the HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.Paginate
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML to PDF element can be paginated to render many PDF pages if necessary.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.EmbedFonts
member.summary: When true this options instructs the HTML to PDF element converter to embed all the true type fonts into the PDF document. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HttpPostFields
member.summary: Returns the collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page in HTML to PDF element. If there are elements in collection then the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection, otherwise it will make a GET request

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type of the HTML document used by the HTML to PDF element. The default media type is 'screen'. If you set this property with 'print' then the CSS properties defined in '@media print' rule will be used to render the document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.SvgFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the SVG fonts are enabled in the HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.WebFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the Web Fonts are enabled in the HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PostScriptFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the fonts with PostScript outlines are enabled in the HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ExtensionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML viewer extensions are executed in HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is false and no extension is executed. The Flash player for Google Chrome must be installed in order to execute the flash content from HTML

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.DownloadAllResources
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML to PDF element should try to download all the resources even if this could cause a slower conversion. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PrerenderEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML to PDF element should perform a pre-rendering. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.InterruptSlowJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the slow JavaScript script should be interrupted in the HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is false and the scripts are not interrupted

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HiddenHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements to be excluded from rendering in HTML to PDF element

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.RenderedHtmlElementSelector
member.summary: Get or set the CSS selector of the HTML element to be rendered by the HTML to PDF element converter. If the selector selects multiple HTML elements, only the the first one will be converted. The CSS selector is case sensitive. If this property is not set then the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.MaxHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels to be rendered from the HTML document by the HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is 0 and the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.MinHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height in pixels to be rendered from HTML document by the HTML to PDF element converter. This value of this property is ignored if the property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.InitialHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial height in pixels of the HTML viewer in HTML to PDF element converter. This value of this property is ignored if the property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.DefaultHtmlEncoding
member.summary: The default HTML document text encoding to be used if there is no charset meta tag defined in the HTML document. By default this property is not set and an auto determined text encoding will be used by converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ImagePartSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels of an image part in HTML to PDF element converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.TriggeringMode
member.summary: The conversion triggering mode used by HTML to PDF element converter. The default value is

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be completely loaded or for a web page redirect to finish before starting the rendering in HTML to PDF element converter.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The HTML to PDF element converter navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the HTML to PDF element converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the method of the property. The property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. By default the property is false and the custom headers are not automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested. The custom HTTP headers can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser. The preferred method to send cookies is to use the property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PersistentHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: This property can be set on true to instruct the HTML to PDF element converter to send the custom headers defined by the property each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. The default value of this property is true and the custom headers are automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HttpRequestCookies
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the HTML to PDF element converter to the web server when the web page to convert and the resources (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page are requested. A cookie is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the method of the property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.XPSupplementalLanguages
member.summary: A flag in HTML to PDF element indicating if the supplemental languages (complex script, right-to-left, East Asian) support was enabled in Windows XP Regional and Language Options. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.TiledRenderingEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if rendering of HTML document is tiled in HTML to PDF element. This property is true by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.InsertNewPagesEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if the HTML to PDF element will always insert a new page in the PDF document when rendering next page instead of trying to use an already existing PDF page. This property is false by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.EnhancedGraphicsQuality
member.summary: A flag indicating the PDF graphics are rendered at the best quality by HTML to PDF element. The default property value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.TransparentImagesEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if the HTML to PDF element converter uses transparency information of the images. The default property value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ImagesScalingEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if the images scaling is allowed in HTML to PDF element. The default property value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.NoSizeElementsEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if the hidden elements are rendered by the HTML to PDF element. The default property value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.TableHeaderRepeatEnabled
member.summary: Get or sets a flag indicating if the repeating of the HTML table header in PDF pages generated by the HTML to PDF element is enabled. Default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.TableFooterRepeatEnabled
member.summary: Get or sets a flag indicating if the repeating of the HTML table footer in PDF pages generated by the HTML to PDF element is enabled. Default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.EvoInternalFileName
member.summary: Sets the full path of evointernal.dat helper file of the HTML to PDF element. By default this file is expected to be found in the same folder with evohtmltopdf.dll assembly.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object encapsulating the proxy options used by HTML to PDF element to access the HTML document to convert.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted in HTML to PDF element converter. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.ImpersonationOptions
member.summary: The impersonation options applied during navigation by HTML to PDF element converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation in PDF for the HTML to PDF element. In order to enable creation of bookmarks you have to set the property of class with the CSS selectors of the HTML elements you want to bookmark.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.PdfFormOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the automatic conversion of a HTML form to a PDF form in the generated PDF document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that can be used to obtain the position in PDF of the HTML elements rendered by the HTML to PDF element. In order to retrieve the position in PDF for a list of HTML elements, the property of class must be set with an array of strings containing the CSS selectors of the HTML elements you want to map. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the object after the element was added to the page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.RenderedPagesRectangles
member.summary: The bounds of the rectangle rendered in each PDF page by the HTML to PDF element. This property is assigned after the element has been added to a PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets an object populated after conversion with the title, keywords, and description of the HTML document rendered by the HTML to PDF element.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfVariableElement
member.summary: This class encapsulates a HTML to PDF converter functionality. Objects of this class can be added at any location in a to render HTML. A conversion is performed for each PDF page where the Template is rendered.

The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width and height. When this parameter is less or equal to 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page height from the HTML document content.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfVariableElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element at the specified x and y coordinates with the specified width and height using a base URL to resolve the external resources and a document URL to resolve the internal links. The virtual browser width and height in pixels is specified by the htmlViewerWidth and htmlViewerHeight parameters.
member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The destination height in points for the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered. Please note that the specified height is the effective height that will be rendered in the PDF document and does not include for example the empty spaces introduced by custom or automatic page breaks.
The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used.
The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML string.
The virtual browser width in pixels. The default value is 1024 pixels. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width.

The virtual browser height in pixels. The default value is 0 which means the height will be auto-determined. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width and height. When this parameter is less or equal to 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page height from the HTML document content.

member.name: T:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter
member.summary: This class offers the necessary methods to create a raster image from a web page at given URL or from a HTML string. The generated image can be saved into a memory buffer or into a file

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a HTML to Image converter using the default width and height for the HTML viewer. The default HTML viewer width is 1024 pixels and the default HTML viewer height is 0 which means the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the default width of 1024 pixels, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the and properties of the HtmlToImageConverter class.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML to Image converter using the specified width in pixels and the default height for the HTML viewer. The default HTML viewer height is 0 which means the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the and properties of the HtmlToImageConverter class.
member.param: The preferred HTML viewer width in pixels.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)

The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the and properties of the HtmlToImageConverter class.

The preferred HTML viewer height in pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred HTML viewer width in pixels in the HTML to Image converter. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width can also be specified in the HtmlToImageConverter class constructor. The default value is 1024 pixels.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels in the HTML to Image converter. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the property. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer height can also be specified in the HtmlToImageConverter class contructor. The default value is 0 to automatically determine the HTML viewer height based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.ClipHtmlView
member.summary: If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer of the HTML to Image converter at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. The HTML viewer width is given by the property. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key string received from the vendor in HTML to Image converter. If this property is null the converter will automatically enter in evaluation mode and a demo watermark will be displayed on the generated image.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if JavaScript execution is enabled in HTML to Image converter. The default is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.Enable3DTransformations
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the accelerated CSS 3D transformations are enabled in the HTML to Image converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.EnableWebGL
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the WebGL is enabled in the HTML to Image converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.EnableAccelerated2DCanvas
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the accelerated 2D canvas is enabled in the HTML to Image converter. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: This property can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted in HTML to Image converter. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.ImpersonationOptions
member.summary: The impersonation options applied during navigation in HTML to Image converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.TiledImageEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if the image captured by converter is tiled. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.DefaultHtmlEncoding
member.summary: The default HTML document text encoding to be used if there is no charset meta tag defined in the HTML document. By default this property is not set and an auto determined text encoding will be used by converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object encapsulating the proxy options used by HTML to Image converter to access the HTML document to convert.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.TransparentBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the resulted image will have a transparent background when converting a HTML documement without a defined background color or image. This property is false by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.HttpPostFields
member.summary: Returns the collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page in the HTML to Image converter. If there are elements in collection then the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection, otherwise it will make a GET request

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type of the HTML document used by the HTML to Image converter. The default media type is 'screen'. If you set this property with 'print' then the CSS properties defined in '@media print' rule will be used to render the document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.SvgFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the SVG fonts are enabled in HTML during HTML to Image conversion. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.WebFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the Web Fonts are enabled in HTML during the HTML to Image conversion. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.PostScriptFontsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the fonts with PostScript outlines are enabled in HTML during the HTML to Image conversion. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.ExtensionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML viewer extensions are executed during the HTML to Image conversion. The default value is false and no extension is executed. The Flash player for Google Chrome must be installed in order to execute the flash content from HTML

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.DownloadAllResources
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML to Image converter should try to download all the resources even if this could cause a slower conversion. The default value is false.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.PrerenderEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML to Image converter should perform a pre-rendering. The default value is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.InterruptSlowJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the slow JavaScript script should be interrupted in HTML to Image converter. The default value is false and the scripts are not interrupted

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.HiddenHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements to be excluded from rendering in HTML to Image converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.AvoidImageBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the HTML to PDF converter to try to avoid cutting off the images between PDF pages. By default this property is false

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.AvoidHtmlElementsBreakSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements to not be broken between PDF pages if possible

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.PageBreakBeforeHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements before which to force a page break in PDF document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.PageBreakAfterHtmlElementsSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS selectors of the HTML elements after which to force a page break in PDF document

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.RenderedHtmlElementSelector
member.summary: Get or set the CSS selector of the HTML element to be rendered by the HTML to Image converter. If the selector selects multiple HTML elements, only the the first one will be converted. The CSS selector is case sensitive. If this property is not set then the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.MaxHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels to be rendered from the HTML document by the HTML to Image converter. The default value is 0 and the entire HTML document is rendered

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.MinHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height in pixels to be rendered from HTML document by the HTML to Image converter. This value of this property is ignored if the property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.InitialHtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial height in pixels of the HTML viewer in HTML to Image converter. This value of this property is ignored if the property is set

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.ImagePartSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height in pixels of an image part in HTML to Image converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.TriggeringMode
member.summary: The conversion triggering mode used by the HTML to Image converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be completely loaded or for a web page redirect to finish before starting the rendering in HTML to Image converter

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The HTML to Image converter navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the HTML to Image converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the method of the property. The property can be set on true to instruct the converter to send the custom headers each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. By default the property is false and the custom headers are not automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested. The custom HTTP headers can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser. The preferred method to send cookies is to use the property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.PersistentHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: The PersistentHttpRequestHeaders property can be set on true to instruct the HTML to Image converter to send the custom headers defined by the property each time an external resource (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page is requested. The default value of this property is true and the custom headers are automatically sent to the web server when the web page resources are requested.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.HtmlToImageConverter.HttpRequestCookies
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the HTML to Image converter to the web server when the web page to convert and the resources (image, css, etc) referenced by the web page are requested. A cookie is defined by a name and a value pair that can be added to the collection using the method of the property.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.ImpersonationOptions.LogonMode

member.summary: Default line cap style.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineCapStyle.ButtCap
member.summary: The stroke is squared off at the endpoint of the path. There is no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineCapStyle.RoundCap
member.summary: A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the endpoint and filled in.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineCapStyle.ProjectingSquareCap
member.summary: The stroke continues beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and is then squared off.

member.summary: This enumeration represents the possible styles to join the lines in a PDF document

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineJoinStyle.Default
member.summary: Default line join style.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineJoinStyle.MiterJoin
member.summary: The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the miter limit parameterâ see "Miter Limit"), a bevel join is used instead.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineJoinStyle.RoundJoin
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pie slice-shaped figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner.

member.name: F:EvoPdf.LineJoinStyle.BevelJoin
member.summary: The two segments are finished with caps (see "Line Cap Style") and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle.

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.AutoBookmarksEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if the automatic creation of bookmarks in PDF for the H1 to H6 HTML elements is enabled or not. By default the automatic bookmarks creation is disabled

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.HierarchicalBookmarks
member.summary: A flag indicating if the bookmarks created in PDF for the HTML elements are arranged in a hierarchy based on the bookmark levels defined in HTML. By default this property is true

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.HtmlElementSelectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the selectors of the HTML elements to be bookmarked. For example, the selector for all the H1 elements is "H1", the selector for all the elements with the CSS class name 'myclass' is "*.myclass" and the selector for the elements with the id 'myid' is "*#myid".

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.AllowDefaultTitle
member.summary: A flag indicating if the HTML elements without text can be bookmarked. This property is true by default

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.DefaultTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the default title to be used for bookmarks that don't have an associated text. This property has effect only if is true. This property defaults to "Bookmark" text

member.name: P:EvoPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.MaxTitleLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum accepted length of the bookmark title string. If a positive value is set for this property the bookmark title will be truncated if necessary. By default and the bookmark title will not be truncated

member.name: T:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfConverter
member.summary: This class is the main class of the HTML to PDF Converter which offers the necessary methods to create a PDF document from a web page at given URL or from a HTML string. The generated PDF document can be saved into a memory buffer or into a file

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF converter using the default width and height for the HTML viewer window. The default HTML viewer width is 1024 pixels and the default HTML viewer height is 0 which means the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the HTML content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the default width of 1024 pixels, the ClipHtmlView property will control whether the HTML content is clipped to the width set for the HTML viewer or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the and properties of the HtmlToPdfConverter class.

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfConverter.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF converter using the specified width in pixels and the default height for the HTML viewer window. The default HTML viewer height is 0 which means the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the and properties of the HtmlToPdfConverter class.
member.param: The HTML viewer width in pixels

member.name: M:EvoPdf.HtmlToPdfConverter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF using the specified width and height in pixels for the HTML viewer window. If the specified HTML viewer height is 0 the HTML viewer height will be automatically determined based on the HTML content and the HTML viewer width in order to make visible the whole HTML content. If the content is not entirely visible in the HTML viewer at the specified width, the property will control whether the HTML content is clipped or the HTML viewer width is automatically extended to make visible the whole HTML content. By default the property is false and the HTML viewer is automatically extended in width to make visible the whole HTML content. The width and height of the HTML viewer can also be controlled by the and properties of the HtmlToPdfConverter class
member.param: The HTML viewer width in pixels
The HTML viewer height in pixels
